value.title: Create allocation table and visualize it in a Gantt Charts with matrix in Power Query
value.excerpt: In this video I will show you how you can create an allocation table in Power query and display the results in a Gantt chart using only the Matrix available in Power BI.  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center  SUBSCRIBE to learn more about Power and Excel BI!

value.title: Data densification in Power Query/ Power BI
value.excerpt: Data densification is basically a technique to densify the dataset or in simpler terms, increase the number of observations in the dataset.   If you want to learn how to do that in Power BI or Power Query, check this video!  Here you can download all the pbix files: https://curbal.com/donwload-center

value.title: DAX FRIDAYS! #178 : My age calculations in DAX and Power Query are wrong!! How do I do it?
value.excerpt: Calculating age is harder that you think, both in power query and dax.  In today's video, I am going to show you two ways to do it with DAX  and power query that get the closest to the actual age.  Do you know any other method to calculate age? Share it in the comments! value.title: Decompress gzip files using Power BI and get access to @EU_Eurostat data.
value.excerpt: In today's video, I will show you how to access Eurostat open data using power bi.  Most data is stored in gzip files and you need to know how to decompress gzip files to be able to get the data. I will show you two methods in this video.  Link to Eurostat data portal: https://ec.europa.eu/eurostat/data/database?node_code=demo_gind

value.title: Extract function in Power Query removes all the text? Here is how to fix it.
value.excerpt: Sometimes when you extract text in Power Query, instead of removing the text you specified, it removes the entire text. value.title: Fix the "Enter data" limitation in Power Query
value.excerpt: If you are trying to import data in Power BI using Power Query "Enter Data", you might see this message: "The clipboard contents are too large to be pasted into the table. Please split your data into multiple tables with less than 3,000 cells".  In this video I will show you one way to get around it.
